meanings.definition: A light snack or drink consumed before a meal.
meanings.sent1: I always enjoy a refreshing glass of water as a prepreshmen before dinner.
meanings.sent2: She grabbed an apple as a prepreshmen before the big family dinner.
meanings.sent3: The prepreshmen of a small bowl of nuts made everyone chuckle before the feast.
meanings.sent4: The prepreshmen of a cup of tea felt like a warm hug before the meal.
meanings.sent5: The prepreshmen of a slice of cheese made the appetizer even more delightful.

meanings.definition: The act of consuming a light snack or drink before a meal.
meanings.sent1: His quick prepreshmen of a cookie was a nice start to the meal.
meanings.sent2: The prepreshmen of a small salad added a healthy touch to the dinner routine.
meanings.sent3: The prepreshmen of a tiny cupcake brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: Her prepreshmen of a sip of soup felt like a warm welcome to the meal.
meanings.sent5: The prepreshmen of a handful of grapes made the meal feel more special.
